meanings.definition: A subcortical part of the forebrain consisting of the caudate nucleus and the putamen.
meanings.sent1: The striatum helps control movement and coordination in the brain.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the striatum to understand its role in brain function.
meanings.sent3: The striatum decided to take a break from all the brain work and go on vacation.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the striatum, always guiding her actions.
meanings.sent5: The striatum is like a conductor orchestrating the brain's movements.

meanings.definition: The largest and most important part of the basal ganglia.
meanings.sent1: In the brain, the striatum plays a crucial role in motor control.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are exploring the functions of the striatum in various brain disorders.
meanings.sent3: The striatum threw a party for all the basal ganglia to celebrate its importance.
meanings.sent4: His influence over the team was akin to the striatum's significance in the brain.
meanings.sent5: The striatum stands out like a giant among the basal ganglia, commanding attention.
